content.hint: The condition of the atmosphere at a particular place and time
content.explanation: Weather refers to the state of the atmosphere, including temperature, humidity, precipitation, and wind.
content.contextSentence: The weather forecast says it will rain tomorrow.

content.hint: A period of time when you don't work and often travel
content.explanation: A vacation is a period of leisure time when people take a break from work or studies.
content.contextSentence: We're going to the beach for our summer vacation.

content.hint: Saturday and Sunday together
content.explanation: The weekend is the period from Friday evening through Sunday, traditionally a time of rest.
content.contextSentence: I usually meet my friends on the weekend.

content.hint: The anniversary of the day someone was born
content.explanation: A birthday is the annual celebration of the date of one's birth.
content.contextSentence: We're having a party for my brother's birthday on Saturday.

content.hint: A device for watching shows and programs
content.explanation: A television is an electronic device for receiving broadcast signals and displaying them as images with sound.
content.contextSentence: My family watches the news on television every evening.

content.hint: A place where people pay to sit and eat meals
content.explanation: A restaurant is a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers.
content.contextSentence: We had dinner at an Italian restaurant last night.

content.hint: The activity of buying things from stores
content.explanation: Shopping is the activity of visiting stores to examine and purchase goods.
content.contextSentence: She enjoys going shopping for clothes on the weekend.

content.hint: An electronic device for processing information
content.explanation: A computer is an electronic device that can store, retrieve, and process data.
content.contextSentence: I use my computer to write emails and browse the internet.

content.hint: A room with a toilet and usually a bath or shower
content.explanation: A bathroom is a room containing a toilet and often a bathtub or shower.
content.contextSentence: Excuse me, where is the bathroom, please?

content.hint: The first meal of the day
content.explanation: Breakfast is the first meal of the day, typically eaten in the morning.
content.contextSentence: I usually have cereal and fruit for breakfast.

content.hint: A person who lives near you
content.explanation: A neighbor is someone who lives next to or close to your house or apartment.
content.contextSentence: Our new neighbors invited us over for dinner.

content.hint: The day before today
content.explanation: Yesterday refers to the day before the current day.
content.contextSentence: I went to the cinema yesterday afternoon.

content.hint: A large store where you can buy food and household items
content.explanation: A supermarket is a large self-service store selling groceries and household goods.
content.contextSentence: I need to go to the supermarket to buy some milk and bread.

content.hint: An official document for traveling to other countries
content.explanation: A passport is an official document issued by a government, certifying the holder's identity and citizenship.
content.contextSentence: Don't forget to bring your passport when we travel abroad.

content.hint: A large building for sports events
content.explanation: A stadium is a large sports venue with tiered seating for spectators.
content.contextSentence: Thousands of fans watched the football match at the stadium.

content.hint: A place where airplanes take off and land
content.explanation: An airport is a place where aircraft regularly take off and land, with buildings for passengers to wait and for aircraft to be serviced.
content.contextSentence: We arrived at the airport two hours before our flight.

content.hint: A place where you can borrow books
content.explanation: A library is a building or room containing a collection of books that can be borrowed or read.
content.contextSentence: She goes to the library every Saturday to study.

content.hint: A piece of paper that allows you to enter a place or travel
content.explanation: A ticket is a piece of paper or card that gives you the right to enter a place, travel by public transport, etc.
content.contextSentence: He bought a train ticket to London.

content.hint: An area of ground where you grow plants or flowers
content.explanation: A garden is a piece of ground next to or near a house where flowers, shrubs, vegetables, or fruit are grown.
content.contextSentence: We planted tomatoes in our garden this year.

content.hint: A person who helps students learn
content.explanation: A teacher is a person whose job is to help students to learn at a school, college, or university.
content.contextSentence: Our English teacher is very friendly and helpful.

content.hint: A special day when you do not have to work or go to school
content.explanation: A holiday is a day when most people do not have to work, usually for a special reason.
content.contextSentence: Christmas is my favorite holiday.

content.hint: A tool for writing or drawing, made of wood and graphite
content.explanation: A pencil is an instrument for writing or drawing, consisting of a thin stick of graphite inside a long thin piece of wood.
content.contextSentence: Please use a pencil to complete the test.

content.hint: An opening in a wall with glass that lets in light
content.explanation: A window is an opening in the wall of a building, fitted with glass, to let in light or air and to allow people to see out.
content.contextSentence: She opened the window to let in some fresh air.

content.hint: A person who helps sick people get better
content.explanation: A doctor is a person with a medical degree whose job is to treat people who are ill or injured.
content.contextSentence: The doctor gave me some medicine for my cough.

content.hint: A very high hill, often with steep sides
content.explanation: A mountain is a large natural elevation of the earth's surface rising abruptly from the surrounding level.
content.contextSentence: We went hiking in the mountains during our trip.

content.hint: A vehicle with two wheels that you ride by pushing pedals
content.explanation: A bicycle is a vehicle with two wheels that you ride by pushing its pedals with your feet.
content.contextSentence: He rides his bicycle to school every day.
